newsitem.title: GREECE: FUND MANAGER WANTS MORE SECTORS LISTED ON ATHENS BOURSE.
newsitem.headline: FUND MANAGER WANTS MORE SECTORS LISTED ON ATHENS BOURSE.

text.p: Two strategic sectors in Greece's economy, merchant marine and tourism, are absent from the Athens stock exchange, the president of the Association of Greek Institutional Investors told a press luncheon.

"For various reasons, two strategic sectors of Greece's economy are absent from the Athens stock exchange -- tourism and merchant marine," said Alexis Pilavios who also heads closed-end fund Alpha Investments .
He told a press luncheon organised by Delos Communications that there were a large number of listed companies on the exchange -- 230 -- with a small number of shareholders.
"There are also quite a few companies whose shareholders do not surpass 300," he said. And the limited number of shareholders has resulted in low trading volumes and wide bid, offer spreads.
He said that starting in the fall of 1997 listed companies will begin to regularly report quarterly on their financial situation.
